sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

tu'a review:

mi djica tu'a lo plise = ?

(Answer: I want something involving the apple)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
saske x1 is science of x2 based on x3 science
sidbo x1 is an idea about x2 in mind x3 idea/concept

Conversion Inside Abstractions

You can use se/te inside nested structures:

lo nu se ctuca cu nandu

Being taught is difficult.

Compare:

  • ctuca: x1 teaches x2 to x3
  • se ctuca: x1 is taught x2 by x3

Examples

mi djica lo nu se dunda lo plise

I want to be given apples.

lo nu se prami cu pluka

Being loved is pleasant.

Deeper Nesting

mi djuno lo du'u lo nu se cilre cu nandu

I know that being taught/learning is difficult.

la .alis. cu jinvi lo du'u lo nu se ctuca cu vajni

Alice thinks that being taught is important.

Key Point

Conversion works anywhere — even deep inside nested abstractions. It shifts perspective.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Conversion in Abstractions

Translate:

  1. Being loved is good.
  2. Being taught is difficult.
  3. I want to be given a book.
Answers
  1. lo nu se prami cu xamgu
  2. lo nu se ctuca cu nandu
  3. mi djica lo nu se dunda lo cukta

Exercise 2: Nested with Conversion

Translate:

  1. I know that being a teacher is important.
  2. Alice thinks that being taught is good.
  3. I believe that being loved is pleasant.
Answers
  1. mi djuno lo du'u lo nu ctuca cu vajni
  2. la .alis. cu jinvi lo du'u lo nu se ctuca cu xamgu
  3. mi krici lo du'u lo nu se prami cu pluka

Exercise 3: New Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. This is a science.
  2. I have an idea.
  3. Science is important.
Answers
  1. ti saske
  2. mi se sidbo or lo sidbo cu se ponse mi
  3. lo saske cu vajni

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "Being taught is difficult." → lo nu se ctuca cu nandu
  2. "This is a science." → ti saske
  3. "I have an idea." → mi se sidbo

Summary

You learned to use conversion (se/te) inside nested abstractions. This allows perspective shifts at any depth.
